qas.question: What caused the suppression of regional cultures?
Of the languages of the are, what was the only approved language?
How did the Catalans show their identity during the dictatorships?
What team was awarded by Franco for having a good relationship?
What motto of the team Barcelona appealed to the Catalans?

context: During the <a0_0>dictatorships<a0_0/> of Miguel Primo de Rivera (1923–1930) and especially of Francisco Franco (1939–1975), all regional cultures were suppressed. All of the languages spoken in Spanish territory, except <a1_0>Spanish (Castilian)<a1_0/> itself, were officially banned. Symbolising the Catalan people's desire for freedom, Barça became <a4_0>'More than a club'<a4_0/> (Més que un club) for the Catalans. According to Manuel Vázquez Montalbán, the best way for the Catalans to demonstrate their identity was by <a2_0>joining Barça<a2_0/>. It was less risky than joining a clandestine anti-Franco movement, and allowed them to express their dissidence. During Franco's regime, however, the <a3_0>blaugrana<a3_0/> team was granted profit due to its good relationship with the dictator at management level, even giving two awards to him.
